body.p: Royalty Bans Rackets To stop racketeering in chanty af fairs members of the royal family have announced in London that be fore promising to attend a ball, pre miere or concert they will insist that the charity in question will benefit to the extent of a sum named by them. Committees must guarantee this minimum, each member taking personal responsibility for a def inite amount, mid paying any deficit out of their pockets. Heretofore all that has been required by royal patrons has been an "assurance, with no figure mentioned.‚Äù Seme recent charity benefits have had receipts of $5 000 of which the charity received less than $500.
